p: Evening primrose oil includes aliphatic alcohols, which make up about 798 mg/kg of the oil, 1-tetracosanol (about 237 mg/kg oil), and 1-hexacosanol (about 290 mg/kg oil) being present in the largest amount. The main triterpenes present are β-amyrin (about 996 mg/kg oil) and squalene (about 0.40 mg/kg oil) [ 8]. The oil contains a small amount of tocopherols: α-tocopherol (76 mg/kg oil), γ-tocopherol (187 mg/kg oil), and δ-tocopherol (15 mg/kg oil) [ 6].
